channel.title: Trevor Campbell on Diana R. Cai
channel.description: Recent content in Trevor Campbell on Diana R. Cai

item.title: Power posteriors do not reliably learn the number of components in a finite mixture
item.description: See also: Finite mixture models do not reliably learn the number of components (arXiv e-print 2007.04470) for results on learning the number of components in a finite mixture model via the usual posterior distribution.

item.title: Finite mixture models do not reliably learn the number of components
item.description: Preliminary versions appeared in NeurIPS 2019 Workshop on Machine Learning with Guarantees and also the Symposium on Advances in Approximate Bayesian Inference 2017, co-located with NeurIPS 2017. Citation @article{cai2020finite, title={Finite mixture models do not reliably learn the number of components}, author={Cai, Diana and Sheth, Rishit and Mackey, Lester and Fusi, Nicolo}, journal={arXiv preprint arXiv:2007.04470}, year={2020} }

item.title: Finite mixture models are typically inconsistent for the number of components
Finite mixture models are typically inconsistent for the number of components
Paintboxes and probability functions for edge-exchangeable graphs
item.description: In NeurIPS 2016 Workshop on Adaptive and Scalable Nonparametric Methods in Machine Learning
